name: Cora
description: Small-scale citation networks. Each node represents a research paper, and each edge represents a citation relationship between two papers. Instead of using the popular version of Cora used in Planetoid [1], we use a refined version [2], which removes duplicated nodes and generates indirect pre-trained word embeddings as node features to solve the problem of information leakage in the original version. As a result, the features become 302-dimension continuous features rather than 1433-dimension binary features in the original version. The task is to classify papers into 7 categories.

refs.mla: Zhilin, Yang, et al. "Revisiting semi-supervised learning with graph embeddings." In *International conference on machine learning* (pp. 40-48). PMLR.
Zou, Xu, et al. "Dimensional Reweighting Graph Convolution Networks." (2019).

name: Citeseer
description: Small-scale citation networks. Similar to *grb-cora*, we use a refined version [2] of CiteSeer [1], which eliminates identical papers and generates text embeddings by pre-trained BERT [3] model. The resulting features are 768-dimension continuous features rather than 3703-dimension binary features in the original version. The task is to classify papers into 6 categories.

refs.mla: Giles, C. Lee, Kurt D. Bollacker, and Steve Lawrence. "CiteSeer: An automatic citation indexing system." Proceedings of the third ACM conference on Digital libraries. 1998.
Zou, Xu, et al. "Dimensional Reweighting Graph Convolution Networks." (2019).
Devlin, J., et al. "Bert: Pre-training of deep bidirectional transformers for language understanding." *arXiv preprint arXiv:1810.04805*. (2018)

name: Flickr
description: Medium-scale social networks. This dataset is built by forming links between images sharing common metadata from Flickr [1]. Edges are formed between images from the same location, submitted to the same gallery, group, or set, images sharing common tags, images taken by friends, etc. The original images are collected from PASCAL, ImageCLEF, MIR, and NUS-wide. We adopt the version from [2], which contains descriptions and common properties of online images. The dataset is processed with a new splitting scheme and feature normalization mentioned in~ef{sec:exp}. The task is to classify images into 7 categories.

refs.mla: McAuley, Julian, and Jure Leskovec. "Image labeling on a network: using social-network metadata for image classification." European conference on computer vision. Springer, Berlin, Heidelberg, 2012.
Zeng, Hanqing, et al. "Graphsaint: Graph sampling based inductive learning method." arXiv preprint arXiv:1907.04931 (2019).

name: Reddit
description: Large-scale social networks. The Reddit dataset [1] is a graph dataset from Reddit posts made in the month of September, 2014. The node label in this case is the community, or “subreddit”, that a post belongs to. 50 large communities have been sampled to build a post-to-post graph, connecting posts if the same user comments on both. In total this dataset contains 232,965 posts with an average degree of 492. The first 20 days are used for training and the remaining days for testing (with 30% used for validation). For features, off-the-shelf 300-dimensional GloVe CommonCrawl word vectors are used. We adopt the Reddit dataset from [2], which contains the communities of online posts based on user comments. The task is to classify communities into 41 categories.

refs.mla: Hamilton, William L., Rex Ying, and Jure Leskovec. "Inductive representation learning on large graphs." arXiv preprint arXiv:1706.02216 (2017).
Zeng, Hanqing, et al. "Graphsaint: Graph sampling based inductive learning method." arXiv preprint arXiv:1907.04931 (2019).

name: AMiner
description: Large-scale citation networks. The papers are collected from the academic searching engine Aminer [1], and the dataset was used in KDD-CUP 2020 Graph Adversarial Attack and Defense competition [2]. The task is to classify papers into 18 categories.

refs.mla: Tang, Jie, et al. "Arnetminer: extraction and mining of academic social networks." Proceedings of the 14th ACM SIGKDD international conference on Knowledge discovery and data mining. 2008.
[2] KDD-CUP 2020 Graph Adversarial Attack and Defense
